valsi.definition: name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: probability - improbability.
discursive: probability - improbability.
the referent of (indirect pointer); uses the referent of a sumti as the desired sumti.
pro-sumti: the referent of the last utterance; the state described: "IT was fun".
combines LA with DOI
valsi.notes: used to address someone in the 2nd person by name and use that as a sumti at the same time, that is: {do} {doi} {la} {broda} is equivalent to la'ei {broda}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ expects $x_2$ on grounds $x_3$.
$x_1$ has probability/likelihood $x_2$ of occurring under conditions $x_3$.
name descriptor: the set of those named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
$z_1=l_1$ gets closer to $l_2$ in property $l_3$ by amount $z_3$.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
single-word non-Lojban name; quotes a single non-Lojban word delimited by pauses (in speech) or whitespace (in writing) and treats it as a name
$le_1$ is a Roman numeral representing $le_3$=$n_1$.
$x_1$ is the Roman nation made up of people $x_2$
valsi.notes: se la'ornai means the Roman people. The term refers to the ancient Romans, not to modern-day residents of the Italian capital, or small Wisconsin town.

valsi.definition: $x_1=l_1$ is Roman Catholic in aspect $x_2=l_2$.
klani modal, 1st place (amount) quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
sumti question asking for a quantity; how many?.
$n_1$ is white bread made from grains $n_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$bi_1$ turns pale/white under condition $bi_3$.
$c_1$ is lymph of animal $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a white blood cell of the blood/pus $x_2$ of animal $x_3$.
$f_1=b_1$ is a whitefish of genus/species $f_2$.
$x_{1}$ is rose.
$x_1$ is an eyewear used/worn by $x_2$ serving purpose $x_3$.
valsi.notes: It is a frame worn in front of the eyes and bears or does not bear transparent/semi-transparent/non-transparent shields for visual correction, eye protection, fashion, or entertainment. The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ relies/depends/counts on/trusts $x_{2}$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$l_1=g_3$ is a dependent territory relying on the sovereignty of $l_2$ (state).
valsi.notes: Examples are British Virgin Islands, Netherlands Antilles, and American Samoa. Cf. {gugde}, {zifyje'a}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is lactic/dairy.
$x_{1}$ (force) lifts/applies raising/supporting force to $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$ in gravity well $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_1$ may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.

valsi.definition: name descriptor: the mass of individual(s) named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
$x_1$ is quantifiable by quantifier $x_2$ on scale $x_3$.
$c_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a street/road name/odonym of street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] $c_{2}$=$l_{1}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: s2 and s3 are omitted. A street name or odonym is an identifying name given to a street. The street name usually forms part of the address (though addresses in some parts of the world make no reference to street names).See also {stucme}, {klaji}, {stuzi}, {cmene}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a train with train car $x_{2}$ with train system $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$g_3=l_1$ is a candle/wax light with wax source $l_2$.
$x_1$ is old/aged [relatively long in elapsed duration] by standard $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also touching, contiguous, against. See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=l_1$ passes by $p_2$ to $p_3$ from $p_4$ by $l_2$.
$l_1=p_1$ is recent, immediately preceding $l_2=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$m_1$ is a mass of set $m_2$ with an even number of members $m_3$
$j_1$ is a sheep bell producing sound $j_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$k_1$ is a shepherd looking after sheep of species/breed $l_2$ of flock $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_1$ is April of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$p_1$ is a lamb of species/breed $l_2$
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
valsi.notes: (cf. midju, nutli; fapro for balancing/opposing forces, nutli)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ (selylanzu for reordered places); relative (= lazmi'u - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu). See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_1$ is a work of art created by an application of craft/skill $x_2$.
$f_1$ is an artist creating work of art $f_2=l_1$ in medium $l_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from elements/ideas $f_4$ .
$m_1$ is a gallery exhibiting $m_2$ at location $m_3$.
$x_1$ is-an-artist/produces $x_2$ by artistic application of skill/craft $x_3$.
$l_1$ is a widow spider of species $l_2$.
$c_1$ sculpts/carves $c_2=l_1$ from $s_2$ using tool $s_1$
valsi.notes: implied c3 is "lo nu jai gau {sraku} s2 fai s1" implied l2 would likewise be "lo si'o nu jai gau {sraku} s2 fai s1"

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_1=c_1=m_1$ meows expressing $x_2=c_3$.
$x_1$ is a panda of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is catnip of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a catfish of genus/species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
$b_1=p_2$ purrs, expressing pleasure at $p_1$ (event/state).
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
Laotze (aka. Laozi)
$r_1=c_1$ sounds quiet/weak at observation point $c_2$ by standard $c_3=t_3$.
$x1=cl2=cm1$ roars $x2=cl1$, expressing $x3=cm3$
$cu_1=r_1$ (agent) whipers $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $cu_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$.
Laos.
valsi.notes: Under some interpretations of the morphology rules, not a valid word.

valsi.definition: $cu_1=cl_1$ shouts $cu_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $cu_3$ via expressive medium $cu_4$, loudly by standard $x_5=cl_3$.
$x_1$ is October of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$g_1$ balances $l_1$ with force $l_2$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is a family farm/ranch at $c_2$, farmed by family $c_3=l_1$ (mass), raising, producing $c_4$.
$z_1$ is the home of family members $z_2=l_2$.
$k_1$ (agent) plays house.
valsi.notes: A child's play to emulate parents.

valsi.definition: non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{1}$ of the previous bridi.
description: marks description extracting the time tense place of the description bridi.
description: marks description extracting the agentive place of the description selbri.
description: marks description extracting the location place of the description bridi.
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{2}$ of the previous bridi.
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{3}$ of the previous bridi.
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{4}$ of the previous bridi.
description pro-sumti: reuses the value of the $x_{5}$ of the previous bridi.
klesi modal, 1st place (scalar set) in/of category ...
replace recent mistakenly uttered text
valsi.notes:
The {lo'ai} ... {sa'ai} ... {le'ai} replacement construct asks the listener to replace the text after {lo'ai} with the text after {sa'ai}. The order {sa'ai} ... {lo'ai} ... {le'ai} is also allowed, and either or both parts can be omitted and thus left up to context. When both parts are omitted, the word {le'ai} on its own indicates that a mistake was made while leaving all the details up to context.
It is also possible to attach SAI to a le'ai construct: le'ai {dai} (or le'ai {da'oi} ko'a) indicates that someone else made a mistake; le'ai {pei} asks whether someone else made a mistake; and {sai}, {ru'e} and {cu'i} can be used to indicate the importance of the substitution. Furthermore, le'ai {nai} can be used to explicitly deny mistakes instead of acknowledging them (compare "sic").

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a loanword meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$ based on foreign-language word $l_2$.
valsi.notes: Old, deprecated synonym for {fu'ivla}. Could be considered an {u'ivla}.

valsi.definition: $xr_1=l_1$ takes back $xr_2=l_2$ from $xr_4=l_3$.
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
$pi_1=pl_1$ employs $pi_2=pl_3$ for a payment/compensation/salary/wage/reward of $pl_2$ for the provision of goods/services $pi_3=pl_4$.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
$t_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles for observational activity $t_2$.
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
valsi.notes: Also confiscate, appropriate. Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied. (cf. punji, cpacu where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, vimcu for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, canci, cliva)

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a/the wisdom tooth of $d_2$
$d_1=l_1$ is the afternoon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$g_1$ is a mushroom of species $g_2$.
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of yours.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
$s_1$ is the taxonomy of $s_2=k_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
valsi.notes: x2 may be subjects of biology, semantics, economics, military science, safety science, etc. Cf. {jutske}, {klesi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ bribes $x_3=p_3$ with $x_2=p_2$ into doing $x_4=p_4$.
$m_1$ is a fridge/air conditioner for cooling $x_2=l_1$.
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of it-1's.
$x_1$ is an electron in quantum state $x_2$
$t_1=l_1$ is tundra at location $t_2$, cold by standard $l_2$
$x_1$ is a lily [Lilium] of species/strain $x_2$
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of mine.
$x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ makes a typo, typing/writing letter $l_1=b_1$ in place of $l_1=b_2$ in word $b_3$ by standard $s_4$
valsi.notes: The standard place covers cases of different spelling conventions in other languages and possibly other dialects of Lojban. For example, 'colour' is a typo is American English, but correct in British English.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$ca_1$ is a keyboard for entering letters/symbols $l_1=cu_2$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol. See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a jamo in syllable $x_2$ in writing system $x_3$ (default Hangul)
$s_1=p_1$ is a line in the text $s_2$.
$t_2$ is a text in medium $t_3$ with character set $l_2$.
$m_3$ is a character encoding for bytes $m_2$ with symbols/font $m_1$.
possessive/associative descriptor: nearby demonstrative possessive; cannot use for 'THAT ...'.
possessive/associative descriptor: immediate demonstrative possessive; cannot use for 'THIS ...'.
possessive/associative descriptor: distant demonstrative possessive.
located descriptor: descriptive that-there (non-demonstrative).
located descriptor: descriptive this-here (non-demonstrative).
located descriptor: descriptive that-yonder (non-demonstrative).
the number/evaluated expression; convert number/operand/evaluated math expression to sumti.
discursive: clearly - obscurely.
discursive: clearly - obscurely.
$v_1$ is an exit out of $c_2$.
lidne modal, 1st place preceded by ...; non-time sequencing.
$li_1=la_1$ immediately precedes $li_2=la_2$ in sequence $li_3=la_3$.
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
marks word as being optional, i.e. the bridi would still be both grammatical AND reflect the speakers opinion/intention would the marked construct be left out
valsi.notes: coi fu'e li'oi la fu'o selpa'i would semantically expand to coi la selpa'i and coi selpa'i meaning that both a person named selpa'i and a beloved one is being greeted (both being the same person).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is fluorine.
$s_1$ is a fluoride of $s_3$.
$t_1$ is a fluoride of $t_3$.
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
$x_{1}$ reflects Libyan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ precedes/leads $x_{2}$ in sequence $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is former/preceding/previous; $x_{2}$ is latter/following.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ before, forerunner; leading, as in 'leading indicators'; $x_2$ after, trailing (= selyli'e for reordered places). See also cmavo list {li'e}, {balvi}, {ralju}, {rebla}, {purci} for time sequence, {jersi}, {porsi}, {jatna}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=v_1$ is a thunderstorm at place/region $t_2$
$s_1$ is thunderous to $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a sound with emit sound-lightning $x_{2}$.
Lithuania.
$x_{1}$ [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences $x_{2}$ (event/experience); $x_{2}$ happens to $x_{1}$.
valsi.notes: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}). See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_1=s_2$ sublimates/evaporates from the solid state at temperature $x_2=f_2=s_3$ with vapor pressure $x_3=f_3$.
valsi.notes: From {sligu} {febvi}; refers to a state change from solid to gas or vice versa, at the solid surface.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= seljda for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= selterjda for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= terjda for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}). See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

valsi.definition: $l_1$ is the Bahai religion with beliefs/practices/tenets including $l_3$
$l_1$ is the Jain religion with beliefs/practices/tenets including $l_3$
$g_1$ is a row (group) showing common property (ka) $g_2$ due to set $g_3$ linked by relations $g_4$.
$x_1=n_1$ is the length of line $x_2=l_1=c_1$ defined by set of points $x_3=l_2$ in measurement system $x_4=n_2=c_3$
valsi.notes: Lines are 1D, so clani2 is derived. Cf. {lutnilcla}

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ (agent) anoints/rubs/greases/pours onto/applies/lubricate/baptises $x_3=p_3$ with liquid/semi-liquid/oil/cream/ointment $x_2=p_2=l_1$.
$g_1$ is a/the energy industry/sector producing fuel/energy source $g_2=l_1 $ for powering $l_2$ based on process $g_3$
$la_1$ is a pool where $li_1$ swims in fluid $li_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) swims in fluid $x_{2}$.
$n_1$ is a flipper [body-part] of $n_2$.
Lindar Kelleigh Greenwood
valsi.notes: First name Lojbanised. A member of the Lojban central community.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ measures $x_2$ lindars in social context $x_3$.
valsi.notes:
The lindar is a measure of social inappropriatenes. One Lindar roughly equals the average social inappropriateness of {lindar} (a Lojban central community member).
One centiLindar = Mentally laughing at something childish / lavatoriously humorous. Five centiLindars = Chuckling out loud at something when it isn't appropriate (i.e. "I'll be working under you for the duration of this project."). One Lindar = Doing something completely socially inappropriate. One and a half lds. = Being offensive enough to get in trouble and / or get reprimanded. Two lds. = Sufficient to get punched in the face on the spot. Three lds. = Sufficient to get stabbed. Four lds. = Sufficient to be a target of assassination.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a nunchaku.
valsi.notes: A Japanese weapon consisting of two wooden sticks connected by a chain; also spelled ``nunchuku''

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a lily-of-the-valley / may-lily (Convallaria) of species/strain $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. junta, tilju; se xalbo, kandi for metaphor)

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is Old English/pertains to Old English-speaking culture in aspect $g_2$, early by standard $x_3=c_2$.
$x_1$ is earlier than $x_2$ by amount of time $x_3$.
$c_1=t_1$ is the earliest among set / range $t_4$.
$lr_1=xa_1$ is / are the earliest person(s) to dwell/live/reside/abide at/inhabit/be a resident of location/habitat/nest/home/abode $xa_2$ among set / range $lr_2$.
$n_1$ is in character (actions or speech to be interpreted as part of a story/role-playing game)
$n_1$ is a drafting by author $l_3=t_1$ of story $l_1=t_2$ using method $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_{2}$ by storyteller $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author. See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also roll, log. ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ is a comic strip about plot/subject/moral $x_2=l_2$ illustrated by $x_3=p_3$ with story written by $x_4=l_3$.
$b_1$ is out of character (actions or speech not to be interpreted as part of a story/role-playing game)
$c_1$ is a story book containing story/tale/yarn/narrative $l_2$ by author $c_3=l_3$ for audience $c_4=l_4$ preserved in medium $c_5$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$cr_1$ is a dress shirt of material $cr_2$, potentially formal by standard $cl_3$.
valsi.notes: A shirt with a collar, a full-length opening at the front from the collar to the hem, and sleeves with cuffs; normally made from woven cloth, and are often accompanied by a jacket and tie, for example with a suit or formalwear, but can be worn also more casually without. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Conditions include temperature and pressure. See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $xe_1=c_1$ is gracious to $xe_2$ in matter $xe_3=c_2$.
$m_1$ is very/extremely polite/courteous/civil in matter $c_2$ according to standard/custom $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a lynx (Felis lynx)
$b_1$ expels $c_1$ from $c_2$; $b_1$ throws $c_1$ out of $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the liver [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$g_1$ causes $c_1$ to leave $c_2$ via route $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a fuel/energy-source for powering $x_{2}$.
veridical descriptor: the one(s) that really is(are) ...
valsi.notes: Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a rather generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

valsi.definition: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
start quote of recent mistakenly uttered text to be replaced
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
Loglan-worker.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
$b_1$ is a broom for purpose $b_2$ (event) with bristles $b_3$.
$l_1=s_1$ undergoes an earthquake/an event of the ground shaking of magnitude $x_2$.
valsi.notes: not necessarily earthquake, could be due to bomb explosion etc. too.

valsi.definition: Bob LeChevalier.
valsi.notes: Bob LeChevalier is one of the Original Lojbanists.

valsi.definition: Lojban.
$b_1$ is the loglan/Loglan/logic language used by community $b_2$ to express ideas $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ infers/concludes/draws conclusion $x_2$ from premise $x_3$ based on logic/reasoning $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}). See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is floor covering/flooring/carpet/rug for covering floor $g_2=l_1$ of $x_3=l_2$.
$c_1$ is underground/buried within ground $c_2=l_1$ of $x_3=l_2$.
$j_1=c_1$ is a landmine with explosive material/principle $j_2$.
$p_1$ (agent) buries/puts underground $p_2=c_1$ under surface $x_3=c_2=l_1$ of $x_4=l_2$.
$b_1$=$r_1$ is a cobblestone of material $b_2$=$r_2$ in floor $l_1$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of aloe vera of species/strain $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
Los Angeles
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
the mass composed of; converts another description type to a mass composed of the members.
elidable terminator: end of sumti qualifiers; usually elidable except before a sumti.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a complex number.
$x_1=c_1$ (person) justifies/expresses justification $x_2=k_2$ for $x_3=p_1$'s complicated-ness in aspect $x_4=p_2$ to audience $x_5=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_6=c_4$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_1=k_1$ (abstract) justifies $x_2=p_1$'s complicated-ness in aspect $x_3=p_2$.
$x_1$ is an earthworm of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_1=k_1$ is a bathroom, in which $x_2=l_1$ washes $x_3=l_2$ (self/other(s)/body part), in home/building/structure $x_4=k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_5=k_3$ (mass/jo'u)
valsi.notes: A room with a sink technically qualifies, but this is more like a room with a bath or shower as well. What most Americans call a "bathroom". For a room specifically for urination or defecation, see {vimku'a}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a wash tub/bath tub, for $l_1$ to wash $p_2=l_2$, made of material $p_3$.
$t_1$ is a sink, for $l_1$ to wash $t_2=l_2$, made of material $t_3$
$x_{1}$ is bare/naked/nude; $x_{1}$ is without cover/clothes/[protection].
$x_1$ is Aries [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From lanme (=sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram];lojban) and lu (=sheep;sumerogram). This constellation has been known as the ram/sheep since babylonian times, and later become the leading sign of the zodiac (7th century BCE). In Hellenistic astrology, the constellation of Aries is associated with the golden ram of Greek mythology that rescued Phrixos.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is Earth's moon (default); $x_{1}$ is a major natural satellite/moon of planet $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ condenses/liquefies on/into $x_{2}$ at temperature $x_{3}$, pressure $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is dew/condensate on $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is a screwdriver for turning screw $k_1$
$x_1$ is Monday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$f_1$ is a dead end of route $f_2=p_1$ from origin $p_3$.
$x_1=n_1$ is the length of path $x_2=p_1=c_1$ between $x_3=p_2$ and $x_4=p_3$ defined by points $x_5=p_4$ (set) where the distance is on scale $x_6=n_2=c_3$
valsi.notes: Paths are 1D, so clani2 is derived. Cf. {lijnilcla}

valsi.definition: $c_1=b_1=k_1$ is a jumper of material $c_2$.
$x1=k1=d1$ lolls from $x2=k2=d2$ at joint $x3=k3=d3$
$c_1=k_1$ is a blouse of material $c_2$.
letteral for l.
London
